stories.text:
Is there a good write-only backup solution?

The best case would be incremental backups to DVDs since they don't allow modification.

Layered on top of that would be a git-like difference algorithm that stored changes rather than whole files.

Truly ideal would be a "write through" backup solution so that the "backup" sits between the computer and the hard drive, writing journal-like changes "on the fly".

Such a solution would make ransomware useless. Even if you encrypt the whole filesystem the backup device could do a git restore.

Does such a solution exist?

If so, is there a better medium write-only medium than DVDs?
stories.title: Best write-only backup solution to stop ransomware?

stories.text:
Experimenting with multiple accounts, I've found that they're able to track devices even when I use TOR browser and follow the instructions (no plugins, not maximizing windows, etc.) With an account already banned, I can create as many new ones as I like, but they are shadow-banned from the start and posts aren't ever visible to anyone else.

Apart from the usual data (OS, CPU, GPU), what other information do they collect that makes it possible for them to match new users with existing ones? Are there any simple ways to prevent this fingerprinting?
stories.title: Ask HN: How does Reddit track users?
